It is the binge eating I find very difficult to control at times. I try to binge on healthy snacks but Im a sucker for chips. Eating more protein seems to help keep it a bay though. Not eating too late at night may help as well. I try not to eat late but its difficult with my work hours.

Im on a 2mg dose of abilify to take the edge off some of the anger, mood swings a depressions. For me, it has helped. I find Im a lot more stable. However, I have had some side effects like gaining a bit of weight (which I can control by going to the gym) and the small muscle twitching is annoying, but I feel for me its working over all.

I would like to take the time to thank everyone who has responded. I wasnt expecting this at all. All your words of encouragement, warmth, concern and compassion. I am truly overwhelmed. 

I do have a therapist and it was his idea for me to do this. He thought it would help and it has. 

Im an ordinary girl trying to make it one day to the next. But all your words will stay with me as well. So thank you everyone for helping me cope and get through this
Thank you for taking the time to say that. It means a lot especially coming from a first responder. Thank you for all that you do as well.

You died on Friday. You were hit by a car seconds before I stepped off the bus along with another gentleman. I saw you every morning walking down the street as I went to work. I ran to help you when no one else did. I did compressions on you before fire department and ambulances got there. I hope you know I did  everything I could. May god keep and rest your soul.

Hey thank you for your response. Ive only been in his medication for a short period of time. I was also diagnosed with chronic depression, social and general anxiety.  Ive had a suicide attempt as some years ago and was hospitalized again three years ago. 

I was told the Abilify could take the edge of the extreme anger and aggression I feel. I was warned about the side effects like the potential for diabetes and weight gain. The first blood tests will be done in 2 weeks. 

So far I think I feel less anger and seem to be thinking more clearly. Or maybe Im over analyzing. However, I also dont feel as hungry. 

I go to therapy every week but I was not thinking that Abilify would be a quick fix. Ive only recently come to terms with a BPD diagnosis. Honestly the class of medication was making me anxious. 

You are right though, I think I will seek a second opinion.
Oh my, Im sorry to hear this. Ill be careful. Thank you for the input.
